Module Frogger
Package p4_group_8_repo.Controllers

Class SelectViewFactory

java.lang.Object
p4_group_8_repo.Controllers.SelectViewFactory
public class SelectViewFactory
extends java.lang.Object
A view factory that allows for selection of the different Views in the game.
This reduces coupling between classes as the caller is not dependent on the class they're calling directly.
If any changes occur to the class being called, the changes will only be reflected on the factory class while the caller remains in the unknown about it.
Created following the Factory Design Pattern. Allows the subclasses to decide which class to instantiate.

  • Method Details

    • getView

      public GameViews getView​(java.lang.String view, int level, ActorControllers actorControllers, Actor actor, World world)
      Gets the view that the client class chooses.
      Instantiates the view based on the choice made.

      The different views can be selected passing one of the following string parameters:
      - "game -> GameScreenView
      - "end" -> EndScreenView
      - "endGame" -> EndOfGame
      Parameters:
      view - to indicate which view is needed
      level - the level of the game chosen by the user
      actorControllers - a controller object required to retrieve data (such as scores)
      actor - the main actor with which users can play the game
      world - the world of the game in which the actors exist
      Returns:
      an instantiation of a GameView object depending on the choice made

    • getView

      public GameViews getView​(java.lang.String view)
      Gets the view that require no parameters based on the client class' choice.
      Instantiates the view based on the choice made.

      The different views can be selected passing one of the following string parameters:
      - "levels -> LevelsMenuView
      - "start" -> StartMenuView
      - "scores" -> HighScoresMenuView
      - "help" -> HelpScreenView
      Parameters:
      view - to indicate which view is needed
      Returns:
      an instantiation of a GameView object depending on the choice made
